title: What are inpatients perceptions about care they have received and how has this changed?
analysis_commentary: The results of the inpatient survey for rating overall care received in hospital has remained fairly consistent between 2005 and 2011. The percentage of respondents who rated their care as ‘very good’ or ‘excellent’ ranged from 77% in 2005 to a maximum of 79% in 2009 and remained at 78% in 2010 and 2011. The percentage or respondents who rated their care as ‘good’ or ‘fair’ varied between 18% and 21% between 2005 and 2011, while the percentage of respondents who rated their care as ‘poor’ remained constant at 2% for most of the data period, increasing slightly to 3% in 2011.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
